text: The Tromsø Bridge is a road bridge in Tromsø, Norway, connecting Tromsdalen on the mainland with Tromsøya island. The bridge, opened in 1960, was the longest in Northern Europe at the time. It has 58 spans and a maximum clearance of to the sea. The bridge replaced a ferry connection and helped boost Tromsø's growth. The bridge is a landmark of Tromsø and is protected against modifications. In 2005, the fencing was raised to prevent suicide. == References == Category:Buildings and structures in Tromsø Category:Transport in Norway
title: Tromsø Bridge
